s.text: "Empire Strikes Back is the best of three Star Wars films," declares the Chicago Sun-Times ' Roger Ebert.
The Empire Strikes Back: Special Edition
' that attended the later episodes of Twin Peaks are likely to be heard again," says Slate's David Edelstein.

Luke Skywalker and Princess Leia are said to have matured into actual characters (as opposed to cartoon ones), and the sage Yoda makes his first appearance, "emerg[ing] from murky nature to become the spiritual center of the whole Star Wars game," says the San Francisco Chronicle 's Peter Stack.

Art --"Willem de Kooning: The Late Paintings, the 1980s";
Book -- Island of the Colorblind , by Oliver Sacks;
Book -- Island of the Colorblind , by Oliver Sacks;
The New York Review of Books complains that Dunne is too breezy: "This is what makes him so readable, but it doesn't give him a voice for brooding."
Book -- A Supposedly Fun Thing I'll Never Do Again: Essays and Arguments , by David Foster Wallace;
Book -- Gladstone: A Biography , by Roy Jenkins;

The inside story of how Dunne and wife Joan Didion turned the Jessica Savitch saga into the 1996 Disney picture Up Close and Personal makes the cover of the March 2 New York Times Book Review , although screenwriter Larry Gelbart summarizes, rather than evaluates, the book: "Monster offers a crash course in getting a script through the hazards of the present-day studio system."
